m_szDocSumamry: Why Hydrogen Cars are Less Efficient Than Electrics Ovidiu Sandru February 9, 2015 Electric Vehicles , Hydrogen Power , Tesla Motors The efficiency of hydrogen cars versus battery electrics has been debated for a long time in the past decade. However, despite of all that talk, these days Toyota unveiled the first widely-available commercial hydrogen fuel cell vehicle hybrid, the Toyota Mirai. I have nothing against hydrogen itself or the hydrogen cars currently produced – it’s clean, burning it produces water and it’s the ideal solution for our oil-hungry transportation system.
